padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1141155">cocofluff</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-22">10/22/21 22:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My favorite of the set. Yummy citrus opening followed by a fruity tuberose that turns creamy and woody. Unfortunately the drydown is much less interesting than the fantastic opening. Sampling this one makes me want to try more citrus florals.<br />
<br />
edit November 2021 I just realized this smells very similar to Tubereuse Hedenie by Roger &amp; Gallet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1432940"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1432940#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1414490" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1414490" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pennypencil"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7840"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.7840.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pennypencil" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Victoria-Beckham-Beauty/21-50-Reverie-97667.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.97667.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="21:50 Rverie"title="21:50 Rverie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1414490ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1414490" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7840">pennypencil</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-21">09/21/21 12:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A fantastic underrated white floral, allegedly by the man who is the white floral master (Dominique Ropion). I say allegedly because presumably it was on a press release once, but traces of confirmation are scant. I really think Penhaligons should make more of their parfumers (as well as pack their parcels better - they really don't make much effort and they arrive dishevelled and grubby; the packaging for the perfumes themselves is splendid of course).  <br />
<br />
There is nothing to dislike here - it's such an amiable tuberose, ironically at odds with its name. On me, this isn't Carnal Flower, which is much more visceral and stemmy; instead it's a barley sugar citrus and bubblegummy tuberose, which evolves into a soft jasmine fragrance. It's utterly lovely and as good as the best white floral scents out there. I put it somewhere between Beach Walk and Fracas, but I enjoy it more than both. Stunning!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1414490"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1414490#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1411956" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1411956" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ajaycheshire"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/333847"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.333847.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ajaycheshire" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1411956ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1411956" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/333847">Ajaycheshire</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-17">09/17/21 04:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>OMG......Helen has a heart! This has surprised me in such a good way! You know when you blind buy and you're full of hope and anticipation?........and then it arrives?..........and then it goes to the back of your collection? <br />
<br />
Well,not this lady! <br />
<br />
She's here and she's beautiful.<br />
<br />
 She is heady,intoxicating,sexy,dreamy,classy,different,sophisticated and comfortable in her own skin and who she is! Yes,this is a winner Penhaligons! <br />
<br />
You've gone all ' Punk and Funk' and I love you for it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1411956"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1411956#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1408558" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1408558" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Hum_C"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1297179"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1297179.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Hum_C" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Initio-Parfums-Prives/Psychedelic-Love-45977.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45977.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Psychedelic Love"title="Psychedelic Love"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1408558ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1408558" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1297179">Hum_C</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-11">09/11/21 13:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I do like this fragrance, it smells very similar to Armani's Vert Malachite. Unfortunately, it does not last on me at all. I sprayed on my skin and clothes today and after 2hrs, I could not smell anything even when I took a close sniff. For a moderately priced designer fragrance I wouldn't mind poor lasting power but at this pricetag, I am quite disappointed. The bottle looks really cool and I intended to buy one initially. But I will stick to my decant for now.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1408558"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1408558#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1405550" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1405550" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mari-Antoinette"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201909"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mari-Antoinette" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1405550ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1405550" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201909">Mari-Antoinette</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-06">09/06/21 14:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A green tuberose when freshly sprayed you can easily smell the mandarins crisp and a little sweet then the mandarins hides behind tuberose.  Im pretty sure the mandarins is holding tuberoses at a gunpoint from her back.   Thats why the tuberose stays green throughout its performance. It dies down a very pleasant warm buy green woodsy tuberose. The bottle is Gorgeous, can be a cold weaponI see how Helen can heartlessly poke someone with itoops . <br />
I dont think its overpriced it has a niche quality, maybe its not very unique .but it is very well crafted. Takes a lot to tame tuberose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1405550"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1405550#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1402298" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1402298" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fragaholic79"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/27512"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.27512.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fragaholic79" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Un-Jardin-Sur-La-Lagune-53373.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53373.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Un Jardin Sur La Lagune"title="Un Jardin Sur La Lagune"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1402298ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1402298" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/27512">fragaholic79</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-31">08/31/21 22:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Created by Dominique Ropion for Penhaligons portrait collection. Heartless Helen is a lovely creamy yet green tuberose. I find most tuberose fragrances sickly sweet especially in our humid weather. But here the citrus cuts through beautifully which saves it from being cloying like most tuberose scents.  If youre looking for a slightly green citrus tuberose for summers, this is it. The longevity is average. A skin scent after a few hours. But the beautiful bottle makes up for it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1402298"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1402298#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1375081" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349583">penguinrabbit</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-26">06/26/21 06:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>While I love florals I've never been a fan of tuberose nearly, every perfume I tried with it in is super sickly. But I got the portraits sample set and might as well try samples on the off chance I'm wrong. I'm glad I did. This is a lot fresher with a mandarin overlay. I like it but like the other portraits the scent doesn't match the marketing. Rose does seem innocent, Blanche doesn't smell like I imagine a woman out for revenge and Helen doesn't smell heartless.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1366278"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1366278#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1361888" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Never ever is it worth the price.<br />
Buy Gucci Bloom instead.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1361888"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1361888#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1298919" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1298919" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="_I.V_"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1309600"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1309600.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="_I.V_" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Madonna/Truth-or-Dare-by-Madonna-Naked-16659.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.16659.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Truth or Dare by Madonna Naked"title="Truth or Dare by Madonna Naked"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1298919ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1298919" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1309600">_I.V_</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-26">02/26/21 02:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It is OK. If you are looking for a fresh, green, citrusy tuberose for summer months it's one of the better options.<br />
Opens with refreshing mandarin citrus, green buttery tuberose. Not a lot of wood. <br />
It was created by Dominique Ropion, and the ingredients are top notch, you can smell the quality.<br />
I say summer only because the performance was not amazing. It actually projected well for the first hour, then it was a little bit better than a skin scent for 4 hours or so. The tuberose is unique, and almost edible (?), it is sooooo buttery plus that mandarin. Such a cold, elegant and refreshing fragrance, I understand why they named it <br />
"Heartless Helen". <br />
Stuck-up aristocrat fragrance.<br />
I wore it to the grocery store, it was windy, and people in line were turning heads and saying "Someone smells good".  So, I guess people could smell it through the masks. But I used like 10 sprays and went shopping right away.<br />
Yes, it is heartless to make such a beautiful scent with bad performance. I understand that Penhaligons perfumes are like watercolor paintings, but I have other fresh fragrances from them, and those are much better. That $300 price point is criminal. If you find it discounted... why not? Be careful with Ebay and such, I see a lot of fakes from portraits collection, and they look very realistic with batch codes and all, impossible to tell the difference (looking at the pictures). Wait till Penhaligons put them on sale, or legit online resellers only.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1298919"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1298919#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1286580" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1286580" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pixie At Heart"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1272806"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pixie At Heart" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1286580ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1286580" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1272806">Pixie At Heart</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-03">02/03/21 15:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh vintage scent, really love it. It's not intrusive and definitely moreish, however way way overpriced and the name is odd - I don't find it cold and heartless at all, if anything I would see the character as a young woman, still a bit naive but full of grace and beauty and curiosity for the world. I'll never waste money on a full bottle but happy to keep the travel edition around, at least I won't get bored of it as it so often happens with fragrances. Sillage is poor but it does last a moderate time, for me anyway.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1286580"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1286580#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1269803" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1269803" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Doresasultanian"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1289792"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1289792.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Doresasultanian" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1269803ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1269803" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); Is it worth half of its value ? of course not !!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1269803"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1269803#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1255488" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/24302">xabaras</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-12-01">12/01/20 18:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really like Heartless Helen. It is the first Tuberose fragrance which does not make me want to go and wash it off. It is sweet but with moderation, not cloying at all and actually light and vibrant. I do not get the citrus nor the woodsiness. My nose only gets tame tuberose. I have a 10 ml sample which will last me forever as I would have to be in the right mood to put this on. Lovely bottle and lovely marketing idea... it almost makes you want to be the cold heartless heartbreaker seeking for the right man to break.. :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; The tuberose is so intensed. But the second, I'm fine with it and got one at home now, spray it from time to time.<br />
<br />
It's a very milky tuberose scent, warm, with some woody scent, not much the sultry of tuberose. <br />
<br />
<br />
<br />
-- Not a fan of tuberose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1178421"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1178421#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1141780" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1141780" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jennyfefs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1205495"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="jennyfefs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/En-Passant-2793.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2793.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="En Passant"title="En Passant"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1141780ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1141780" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1205495">jennyfefs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-02-05">02/05/20 03:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I agree with other reviewers about longevity and sillage. Very below average, especially for a Penhaligon's scent.<br />
I really like it though but the tester wasn't enough. You need quite an amount to get enough of a hit of fragrance.<br />
The mandarin orange and tuberose doesn't last long on me at all and it dries to a rather musky yet clean wood scent on my skin. <br />
If I had unlimited funds, I would buy this, but as it is, it does not match some of the others from the range.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1141780"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1141780#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1127874" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1127874" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Capfi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1207514"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1207514.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Capfi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nissaba/MALLI-NADU-91045.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.91045.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="MALLI NADU"title="MALLI NADU"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1127874ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1127874" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1207514">Capfi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-12-26">12/26/19 09:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I received this Fragrance as a Christmas present from my husband.<br />
I am in love with the bottle, it is simply amazing.<br />
The Fragrance itself is very feminine, soft and elegant. <br />
I am not normally a fan of tuberose but here combined with the mandarine and creamy woods it is just perfect. Heartless Helen will definitely break some hearts.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1127874"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1127874#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1091792" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1091792" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="shushkin"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/106159"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.106159.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="shushkin" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/4160-Tuesdays/White-Queen-51566.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51566.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="White Queen"title="White Queen"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1091792ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1091792" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/106159">shushkin</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-08-27">08/27/19 02:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is actually a nice, very simple tuberose centred fragrance.  Not headache inducing and neither a total wimp. I can understand why Carnal Flower and Fracas are mentioned. I already have those so sadly this lovely is redundant.<br />
My mind also jumped on the memory of when I last wore Gucci Bloom.I has a little less sweetness than Bloom. It's possibly more clean smelling. You would be hard pushed to make someone wince if they invaded your personal space wearing this.<br />
The tuberose fades quickly back and then it's the woods with a touch of zesty mandarine. It finally closes as rather soapy tuberose.<br />
It is lovely but longevity and sillage are well below average on me.<br />
The rrp is just silly. Maybe it's the bottle you are largely paying for! I've got to say the bottle really does appeal to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1091792"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1091792#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1090007" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1090007" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tam"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/15130"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.15130.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tam" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Arabian-Oud/Ghroob-22050.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.22050.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ghroob"title="Ghroob"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1090007ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1090007" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/15130">Tam</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-08-21">08/21/19 12:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have much love for this house and this is a lovely tuberose scent. But I feel I have it already through owning Tubereuse Criminelle, Carnal Flower and Fracas.  If you have any of these it would be debatable as to whether you need this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1090007"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1090007#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1087453" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1087453" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pempipot"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1178494"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1178494.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pempipot" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Cologne/Cafe-Tuberosa-45964.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45964.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Caf Tuberosa"title="Caf Tuberosa"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1087453ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1087453" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1178494">Pempipot</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-08-13">08/13/19 12:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was sent a sample from Penhaligon's. The portrait collection is always interesting to sample, even if my feeling with this line is that there's too much hype and not enough substance, They are good scents, but as often with Penhaligon's they lack complexity.<br />
<br />
At my first try I would have said the same of this scent. I definitely wouldn't compare this to Carnal Flower... of course, it's tuberose, but Carnal Flower is exasperated complexity, while here that complexity is much more hidden. At the beginning it's easy to put Helen down as a simple, linear perfume: tuberose is powerful and tends to overwhelm everything else. However there's so much more going on here.<br />
<br />
The perfume pyramid is quite simple and not all that helpful. Yes, the opening has a pretty sharp note in it that could be mandarin (but I also detect some pepper and spices). But than something interesting happen: the tuberose becomes a bridge that links the opening directly to the base (oud, yes... but there's some oakmoss and something els, which I'm not skilled enough to describe) creating an incredible balsamic counterpoint to the tuberose itself.<br />
<br />
Creamy bubblegum perfectly describe it, indeed, but there's something else: this mandarin/oud bridge is what makes Helen special. And different. After a couple of tries I must admit I'm absolutely intrigued and will be considering the full bottle (despite the overwhelming price). It's a pity that the drydown loses that interesting balsamic twist to become a more linear, creamy tuberose.<br />
<br />
Should also add that both sillage and longevity aren't as strong as you would expect from a tuberose scent. Which might be ok but considering the price it's a bit disappointing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1087453"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1087453#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1069165" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1069165" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Coy Chickpea"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1188692"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1188692.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Coy Chickpea" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/L-Artisan-Parfumeur/Seville-a-l-Aube-14639.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14639.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Seville a l'Aube"title="Seville a l'Aube"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1069165ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1069165" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1188692">Coy Chickpea</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-06-11">06/11/19 07:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The SA in Harrod's tells me the nose behind this fragrance is Dominique Ropion, which explains why it is 90% similar to Carnal Flower. If I hadn't already just purchased the latter, I would have been very tempted to buy Helen. She's a loud tuberose through-and-through. Compared to Carnal Flower I got a bit more citrus and slightly less camphor, and of course the longevity is overall weaker (I took away a perfumed handkerchief doused in the stuff, and it lasted only a day compared to my sample of the other gorgeous Harrod's exclusive I tried - Mr Harrod (an intense plum-spicy-woody-oud fragrance, NIDB) - which is still going strong a week later). <br />
<br />
My friend told me it smelt like kitchen cleaner, so clearly a divisive scent. However I wish my kitchen smelt like this!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1069165"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1069165#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1067975" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1067975" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GeorgeY"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/914441"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.914441.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="GeorgeY" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1067975ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1067975" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/914441">GeorgeY</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-06-07">06/07/19 11:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>01-06-2019<br />
<br />
I briefly tried it on the card in Harrods. It's a creamy bubblegum alike sweet tuberose scent similar to the current version of Fraca by Robert Piguet</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1067975"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1067975#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>

My mind also jumped on the memory of when I last wore Gucci Bloom.I has a little less sweetness than Bloom. It's possibly more clean smelling. You would be hard pushed to make someone wince if they invaded your personal space wearing this.<br />

Yes!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1231778"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1231778#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1414490" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1414490" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pennypencil"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7840"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.7840.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pennypencil" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Victoria-Beckham-Beauty/21-50-Reverie-97667.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.97667.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="21:50 Rverie"title="21:50 Rverie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1414490ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1414490" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7840">pennypencil</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-21">09/21/21 12:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A fantastic underrated white floral, allegedly by the man who is the white floral master (Dominique Ropion). I say allegedly because presumably it was on a press release once, but traces of confirmation are scant. I really think Penhaligons should make more of their parfumers (as well as pack their parcels better - they really don't make much effort and they arrive dishevelled and grubby; the packaging for the perfumes themselves is splendid of course).  <br />
<br />
There is nothing to dislike here - it's such an amiable tuberose, ironically at odds with its name. On me, this isn't Carnal Flower, which is much more visceral and stemmy; instead it's a barley sugar citrus and bubblegummy tuberose, which evolves into a soft jasmine fragrance. It's utterly lovely and as good as the best white floral scents out there. I put it somewhere between Beach Walk and Fracas, but I enjoy it more than both. Stunning!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1414490"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1414490#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1087453" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1087453" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pempipot"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1178494"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1178494.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pempipot" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Cologne/Cafe-Tuberosa-45964.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45964.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Caf Tuberosa"title="Caf Tuberosa"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1087453ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1087453" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1178494">Pempipot</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-08-13">08/13/19 12:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was sent a sample from Penhaligon's. The portrait collection is always interesting to sample, even if my feeling with this line is that there's too much hype and not enough substance, They are good scents, but as often with Penhaligon's they lack complexity.<br />
<br />
At my first try I would have said the same of this scent. I definitely wouldn't compare this to Carnal Flower... of course, it's tuberose, but Carnal Flower is exasperated complexity, while here that complexity is much more hidden. At the beginning it's easy to put Helen down as a simple, linear perfume: tuberose is powerful and tends to overwhelm everything else. However there's so much more going on here.<br />
<br />
The perfume pyramid is quite simple and not all that helpful. Yes, the opening has a pretty sharp note in it that could be mandarin (but I also detect some pepper and spices). But than something interesting happen: the tuberose becomes a bridge that links the opening directly to the base (oud, yes... but there's some oakmoss and something els, which I'm not skilled enough to describe) creating an incredible balsamic counterpoint to the tuberose itself.<br />
<br />
Creamy bubblegum perfectly describe it, indeed, but there's something else: this mandarin/oud bridge is what makes Helen special. And different. After a couple of tries I must admit I'm absolutely intrigued and will be considering the full bottle (despite the overwhelming price). It's a pity that the drydown loses that interesting balsamic twist to become a more linear, creamy tuberose.<br />
<br />
Should also add that both sillage and longevity aren't as strong as you would expect from a tuberose scent. Which might be ok but considering the price it's a bit disappointing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1087453"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1087453#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1069165" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1069165" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Coy Chickpea"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1188692"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1188692.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Coy Chickpea" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/L-Artisan-Parfumeur/Seville-a-l-Aube-14639.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14639.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Seville a l'Aube"title="Seville a l'Aube"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1069165ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1069165" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1188692">Coy Chickpea</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-06-11">06/11/19 07:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The SA in Harrod's tells me the nose behind this fragrance is Dominique Ropion, which explains why it is 90% similar to Carnal Flower. If I hadn't already just purchased the latter, I would have been very tempted to buy Helen. She's a loud tuberose through-and-through. Compared to Carnal Flower I got a bit more citrus and slightly less camphor, and of course the longevity is overall weaker (I took away a perfumed handkerchief doused in the stuff, and it lasted only a day compared to my sample of the other gorgeous Harrod's exclusive I tried - Mr Harrod (an intense plum-spicy-woody-oud fragrance, NIDB) - which is still going strong a week later). <br />
<br />
My friend told me it smelt like kitchen cleaner, so clearly a divisive scent. However I wish my kitchen smelt like this!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1069165"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1069165#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="55442" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>

I don't get the hype at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1984032"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1984032#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1576639" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1576639" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smellgewd1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1469293"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1469293.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="smellgewd1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marc-Jacobs/Daisy-Love-49108.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49108.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Daisy Love"title="Daisy Love"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1576639ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1576639" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1469293">smellgewd1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-02">06/02/22 21:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>this smells exactly like room or car freshener. and a lil bit playdough-y. I love orange and tuberose but didn't expect it would smell like this. I would still wear this but only layered with other perfumes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="1576639"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=1576639#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2014718" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2014718" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smelling.sniffing.swan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1892188"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1892188.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="smelling.sniffing.swan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2014718ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2014718" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1892188">smelling.sniffing.swan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-29">12/29/23 19:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Hi Helen<br />
What I mostly got in the opening was lots of fennel, with a liquorice-y-ness.<br />
I get a bit of orange/mandarin, but more of a slightly bitter orange cooking essence, rather than fresh fruit.<br />
There's a soapy, almost detergent element here that I'm not loving, catches in my throat a bit.<br />
<br />
As it softens down the tuberose becomes very apparent. While I generally really enjoy tuberose, I feel that Helen is missing some of the context surrounding the tuberose note that would make it more enjoyable. A soft, vague, creamy muskiness underneath which is very much ... fine.<br />
<br />
Pretty poor performance. I saw a review here where someone described this as very scented-candle like, which is absolutely spot on.<br />
<br />
VERDICT: Hi Helen. Bye Helen.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="2014718"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=2014718#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2133776" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2133776" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ziva99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1898768"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1898768.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ziva99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2133776ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2133776" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1898768">Ziva99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-23">04/23/24 09:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tuberose in a cloudy weather. <br />
I couldnt like this one. <br />
<br />
If you are looking for gourmand tuberose perfume, I recommend Le Couvent  Maison de Parfums Tuberosa by Jean-Claude Ellena. Its much better price and having depths.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="55442"comment_id="2133776"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html?ccid=2133776#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="55442" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
